qas.question: What is the term for closing off rivers that are no longer connected?
What do closed rivers serve as after they close?
When was the construction that changed the Rhine's Delta?
What is one aspect of the hydrography of the former delta characterized by?
What changed the Delta in the first half of the 20th Century?
In what century did the marine bays join the sea?
What water runs out of the sea and out of the former marine bay?

context: The hydrography of the current delta is characterized by the <b4_0>delta's main arms<b4_0/>, disconnected arms (Hollandse IJssel, Linge, Vecht, etc.) and smaller rivers and streams. Many rivers have been closed ("<a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>dammed<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>") and now serve as <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>drainage channels<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> for the numerous polders. The <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>construction of <b5_0>Delta Works<b5_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> changed the Delta in the <a3_2>second half of the <a3_0><a3_1><b6_0>20th Century<b6_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> fundamentally. Currently <b7_0>Rhine<b7_0/> water runs into the sea, or into former marine bays now separated from the sea, in five places, namely at the mouths of the Nieuwe Merwede, Nieuwe Waterway (Nieuwe Maas), Dordtse Kil, Spui and IJssel.
